Hi guys, i'm trying to develop an android app that needs to be sync with another app installed in a pc; in your experience, what connection method do you think is better taking into account that the synchronization needs to be as fast as possible, at any time, bidirectional for both (android and the pc apps):
 1- Connection through a web service
 2- Wifi P2P
 3- other method
Thanks for your answers
<@U1XTP7L1M|tahab621> has joined the channel
gcm and a remote server
firebase is a good example of an all in one
<@U1TKETBU3>: you could make the pc app the server and make the mobile app broadcast a discover message to discover the IP of the PC and start a connection.
But what sync do you mean btw? It really depends on what type of sync you need
^ true but he said account information which really isn’t very much data usually
don’t do wifi p2p, it is basically useless on android which is why no one uses it
<@U061HDV96>: from the android app, i need to sync sensors data, and from the pc execute actions according to user input and receive and analyze the sensor data and return other values
I guess starting an active connection will be fine for that and send json or something across it.
But I'm not sure about firewall problems.
You'll have to do some googling.
yes, i think the firewall should be disabled
or just set a rule instead of turning off the entire firewall
^ Or you could send discover messages from your PC which will establish a connection after. Outgoing and established connection will go through.
hate to clarify that but ive seen to many guides that are 1) turn off the firewall.
I'm sure the firewall stuff on mobile phones is easier
making connections on a lan usually are not blocked by firewalls
if both devices are outgoing it should work fine in most cases
How does the Chromecast do it?
You could look at libraries for casting how they discover and make a connection
<@U061HDV96>: <https://support.google.com/accounts/answer/6260286?hl=en>

text: Oh yea I forgot about that
same way your printer works, it broadcasts messages that can be searched for on a network
I was gonna implement that to interact between an iPad app and iPhone/Android app
i'm going to research around those options, thanks guys
you can look at this to get an idea of how most devices perform discovery on local networks <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonjour_(software)>
zero-conf is the other name (but not quite the same thing)

I like bonjour as you can get chrome plugins to discover advertised services on your network. When I was working on making phones talk to each other directly, I used bonjour and some quick java code to test connectivity between a laptop and phone before trying phone to phone
aka, should be easy to accomplish because im an idiot and I figured it out :wink:
